byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and NATE SCHWEBER

lead_paragraph: Paul Mathurin was wounded in the hip by police officers who were responding to reports of a man waving a gun. The accounts from some witnesses, however, differed from that of the police.

headline.print_headline: Police Shoot Man in Brooklyn; Officials Say He Was Threatening People With a Handgun
headline.main: Police Shoot Man in Brooklyn; Officials Say He Had a Gun

snippet: Paul Mathurin was wounded in the hip by police officers who were responding to reports of a man waving a gun. The accounts from some witnesses, however, differed from that of the police....
abstract: New York City police officers shoot Brooklyn man Paul Mathurin in hip after he reportedly waived handgun and confronted people in Prospect-Lefferts Garden neighborhood; witnesses give differing accounts of incident, complicating investigation.
